coredata.dc:title: Automated feedback generation for argument-based intelligent tutoring systems
coredata.prism:publicationName: CSEDU 2019 - Proceedings of the 11th International Conference on Computer Supported Education

abstract.publishercopyright: Copyright © 2019 by SCITEPRESS – Science and Technology Publications, Lda. All rights reserved.
abstract.ce:para: Argument-based machine learning provides the ability to develop interactive learning environments that are able to automatically select relevant examples and counter-examples to be explained by the students. However, in order to build successful argument-based intelligent tutoring systems, it is essential to provide useful feedback on students’ arguments and explanations. To this end, we propose three types of feedback for this purpose: (1) a set of relevant counter-examples, (2) a numerical evaluation of the quality of the argument, and (3) the generation of hints on how to refine the arguments. We have tested our approach in an application that allows students to learn by arguing with the aim of improving their understanding of financial statements.

item-info.copyright: Copyright 2019 Elsevier B.V., All rights reserved.

citation-title.titletext: Automated feedback generation for argument-based intelligent tutoring systems

abstract.ce:para: Argument-based machine learning provides the ability to develop interactive learning environments that are able to automatically select relevant examples and counter-examples to be explained by the students. However, in order to build successful argument-based intelligent tutoring systems, it is essential to provide useful feedback on students’ arguments and explanations. To this end, we propose three types of feedback for this purpose: (1) a set of relevant counter-examples, (2) a numerical evaluation of the quality of the argument, and (3) the generation of hints on how to refine the arguments. We have tested our approach in an application that allows students to learn by arguing with the aim of improving their understanding of financial statements.
